label: Protect Operations Security Information from exploitation by foreign adversaries
quote: Operations Security Information means Department of Homeland Security information that could be collected, analyzed, and exploited by a foreign adversary to identify intentions, capabilities, operations, and vulnerabilities that threaten operational security for the missions of the Department;

label: Protect Personnel Security Information to prevent physical risk
quote: Personnel Security Information means information that could result in physical risk to Department of Homeland Security personnel or other individuals whom the Department is responsible for protecting;

label: Protect Physical Security Information related to Federal buildings, grounds, or property
quote: Physical Security Information means reviews or reports illustrating or disclosing facility infrastructure or security vulnerabilities related to the protection of Federal buildings, grounds, or property. For example, threat assessments, system security plans, contingency plans, risk management plans, business impact analysis studies, and certification and accreditation documentation;

label: Contractor SHALL protect Privacy Information including PII and SPII.
quote: Privacy Information includes both Personally Identifiable Information (PII) and Sensitive Personally Identifiable Information (SPII)... Certain data elements are particularly sensitive and may alone present an increased risk of harm to the individual.

label: Contractor SHALL recognize that non-PII can become PII when combined with other information.
quote: it is important to recognize that information that is not PII can become PII whenever additional information becomes available, in any medium or from any source, that would make it possible to identify an individual.

label: Contractor SHALL treat certain data elements as particularly sensitive stand-alone PII.
quote: Examples of stand-alone PII that are particularly sensitive include: Social Security numbers (SSNs), driver’s license or State identification numbers, Alien Registration Numbers (A-numbers), financial account numbers, and biometric identifiers.

label: Contractor SHALL treat groupings of information containing an individual’s name or unique identifier plus one or more specified elements as SPII.
quote: SPII may also consist of any grouping of information that contains an individual’s name or other unique identifier plus one or more of the following elements: (A) Truncated SSN (such as last 4 digits); (B) Date of birth (month, day, and year); (C) Citizenship or immigration status; (D) Ethnic or religious affiliation; (E) Sexual orientation; (F) Criminal history; (G) Medical information;

label: Contractor employees must complete necessary forms for security or other reasons, including background investigations.
quote: Contractor employees working on this contract must complete such forms as may be necessary for security or other reasons, including the conduct of background investigations to determine suitability.

label: Completed forms shall be submitted as directed by the Contracting Officer.
quote: Completed forms shall be submitted as directed by the Contracting Officer.

label: Contractor employees shall be fingerprinted or subject to other investigations as required.
quote: Upon the Contracting Officer’s request, the Contractor’s employees shall be fingerprinted or subject to other investigations as required.

label: All Contractor employees requiring recurring access to government facilities or access to CUI or information resources are required to have a favorably adjudicated background investigation prior to commencing work unless waived.
quote: All Contractor employees requiring recurring access to government facilities or access to CUI or information resources are required to have a favorably adjudicated background investigation prior to commencing work on this contract unless this requirement is waived under departmental procedures.

label: Contractor may be required to prohibit individuals from working on the contract if deemed contrary to public interest.
quote: The Contracting Officer may require the Contractor to prohibit individuals from working on the contract if the Government deems their initial or continued employment contrary to the public interest for any reason, including, but not limited to, carelessness, insubordination, incompetence, or security concerns.

label: Contractor shall access and use CUI only for the purpose of furnishing advice or assistance directly to the Government and shall not disclose CUI unless authorized in writing.
quote: The Contractor shall access and use CUI only for the purpose of furnishing advice or assistance directly to the Government in support of the Government’s activities, and shall not disclose, orally or in writing, CUI for any other purpose to any person unless authorized in writing by the Contracting Officer.

label: Contractor shall ensure authorized employees receive initial and refresher training on CUI protection and disclosure.
quote: For those Contractor employees authorized to access CUI, the Contractor shall ensure that these persons receive initial and refresher training concerning the protection and disclosure of CUI. Initial training shall be completed within 60 days of contract award and refresher training shall be completed every 2 years thereafter.

label: Contractor shall include this clause in all subcontracts at any tier where the subcontractor may have access to government facilities, CUI, or information resources.
quote: The Contractor shall include this clause in all subcontracts at any tier where the subcontractor may have access to government facilities, CUI, or information resources.

label: Each individual employed under the contract shall be a U.S. citizen or a lawfully admitted permanent resident, with exceptions approved by the Chief Security Officer.
quote: Each individual employed under the contract shall be a citizen of the United States of America, or an alien who has been lawfully admitted for permanent residence as evidenced by a Permanent Resident Card (USCIS I-551). Any exceptions must be approved by the Department’s Chief Security Officer or designee.

label: Identify non-U.S. citizens in proposal
quote: Contractors shall identify in their proposals, the names and citizenship of all non-U.S. citizens proposed to work under the contract.

label: Report additions or deletions of non-U.S. citizens after award
quote: Any additions or deletions of non-U.S. citizens after contract award shall also be reported to the Contracting Officer.

label: Notify individuals of PII/SPII incidents within 5 business days after direction from Contracting Officer
quote: No later than 5 business days after being directed by the Contracting Officer...the Contractor shall notify any individual whose PII or SPII was either under the control of the Contractor or resided in an information system under control of the Contractor at the time the incident occurred.

label: Coordinate notification method and content with Contracting Officer and obtain written approval before proceeding
quote: The method and content of any notification by the Contractor shall be coordinated with, and subject to prior written approval by, the Contracting Officer. The Contractor shall not proceed with notification unless directed in writing by the Contracting Officer.

label: Notification method may include letters, electronic means, or public notice as approved by Government
quote: the notification method may consist of letters to affected individuals sent by first-class mail, electronic means, or general public notice, as approved by the Government.

label: Notification may require use of address verification and/or address location services
quote: Notification may require the Contractor’s use of address verification and/or address location services.

label: Notification must include a brief description of the incident
quote: At a minimum, the notification shall include: (i) A brief description of the incident;

label: Description of types of PII or SPII involved in incident
quote: A description of the types of PII or SPII involved;
short_label: Describe types of PII/SPII in incident

label: Statement on encryption or protection of PII or SPII
quote: A statement as to whether the PII or SPII was encrypted or protected by other means;
